taskbody.context: To create custom profiling attributes for a specific document type, follow these steps:

step.cmd: Make sure the attribute is already defined in the document DTD or schema before continuing with the procedure.
and go to Editor Edit modes Author Profiling/Conditional Text .
In the Profiling Attributes section, press the New button.

stepresult.p:
The Profiling Attribute dialog box is opened. Profiling Attribute Dialog Box
Profiling Attribute Dialog Box

step.cmd: Fill-in the dialog box as follows:

substep.cmd: Choose the Document type for which the profiling attribute is applied. * and ? can be used as wildcards, while ,(comma character) can be used to specify more patterns. For example, use DITA* to match any document type name that starts with DITA.
Specify a Display name. This field is optional, being used only as a descriptive rendering in profiling dialog boxes.
Use the New, Edit, Delete buttons to add, edit, or delete possible values of the attribute. You can also specify an optional description for each attribute value.

Choose whether the attribute accepts a Single value or Multiple values separated by a delimiter (space, comma, semicolon, or a custom one). A custom delimiter must be supported by the specified document type. For example, the DITA document type only accepts spaces as delimiters for attribute values.

step.cmd: Click Apply to save the profiling attribute.
